name: pettiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of lacking importance: It was the pettiness of their arguments that irritated her. The murders have shocked the nation because of the pettiness of the dispute.
the quality of complaining or getting angry about things that are not important: Arnold detested pettiness, meanness of spirit, and small mindedness. He is keenly aware of the sheer pettiness that can be the only revenge of unhappy people. See
petty
More examplesFewer examplesIt's a symbol of both the strength and vitality of America and the pettiness and greed of America. He's thinking of moving to New York to get away from the gossipy pettiness of the British press. Criticism is often based on pettiness, ignorance or even lack of experience or understanding.
